acknowledgments.summary: reported vulnerabilities CVE-2025-66590, CVE-2025-66589, CVE-2025-66588, and CVE-2025-66585 to CISA
reported vulnerabilities CVE-2025-66586, CVE-2025-66589, and CVE-2025-66590 to Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative
reported vulnerabilities CVE-2025-66585, CVE-2025-66586, CVE-2025-66589, and CVE-2025-66590 to Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative

notes.text: This product is provided subject to this Notification (https://www.cisa.gov/notification) and this Privacy & Use policy (https://www.cisa.gov/privacy-policy).
notes.title: Legal Notice and Terms of Use

notes.text: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities requires an attacker to upload a malicious .ctl file. This could lead to information disclosure or arbitrary code execution.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: Critical Manufacturing
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: Worldwide
notes.title: Countries/areas deployed

notes.text: United States
notes.title: Company headquarters location

notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of these vulnerabilities, such as:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Minimize network exposure for all control system devices and/or systems, ensuring they are not accessible from the internet.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Locate control system networks and remote devices behind firewalls and isolating them from business networks.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: When remote access is required, use more secure methods, such as Virtual Private Networks (VPNs), recognizing VPNs may have vulnerabilities and should be updated to the most current version available. Also recognize VPN is only as secure as the connected devices.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on cisa.gov/ics. Several CISA products detailing cyber defense best practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA encourages organizations to implement recommended cybersecurity strategies for proactive defense of ICS assets.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics in the technical information paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing suspected malicious activity should follow established internal procedures and report findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA also recommends users take the following measures to protect themselves from social engineering attacks:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Do not click web links or open attachments in unsolicited email messages.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Refer to Recognizing and Avoiding Email Scams for more information on avoiding email scams.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Refer to Avoiding Social Engineering and Phishing Attacks for more information on social engineering attacks.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploitation specifically targeting these vulnerabilities has been reported to CISA at this time. These vulnerabilities are not exploitable remotely. These vulnerabilities have a high attack complexity.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

revision_history.summary: Update A - Updated researcher section, removed CVE-2025-66584 and CVE-2025-66587 after additional analysis showed they are duplicative to other CVEs in the advisory.
Updated acknowledgments and revision history summary for Update A.

notes.text: In AzeoTech DAQFactory release 20.7 (Build 2555), an Out-of-bounds Write vulnerability can be exploited by an attacker to cause the program to write data past the end of an allocated memory buffer. This can lead to arbitrary code execution or a system crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: AzeoTech has released the following update that addresses these issues:
DAQFactory: Release 21.1
AzeoTech also recommends users take the following actions to reduce the risk:
Users are discouraged from using documents from unknown/untrusted sources.
Users are encouraged to store .ctl files in a folder only writeable by admin-level users.
Users are encouraged to operate in "Safe Mode" when loading documents that have been out of their control.
Users are encouraged to apply a document editing password to their documents.

notes.text: In AzeoTech DAQFactory release 20.7 (Build 2555), an Out-of-bounds Read vulnerability can be exploited by an attacker to cause the program to read data past the end of an allocated buffer. This could allow an attacker to disclose information or cause a system crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: AzeoTech has released the following update that addresses these issues:

AzeoTech also recommends users take the following actions to reduce the risk:
Users are discouraged from using documents from unknown/untrusted sources.
Users are encouraged to store .ctl files in a folder only writeable by admin-level users.
Users are encouraged to operate in "Safe Mode" when loading documents that have been out of their control.
Users are encouraged to apply a document editing password to their documents.

notes.text: In AzeoTech DAQFactory release 20.7 (Build 2555), an Access of Uninitialized Pointer vulnerability can be exploited by an attacker which can lead to arbitrary code execution.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: AzeoTech has released the following update that addresses these issues:

AzeoTech also recommends users take the following actions to reduce the risk:

cwe.name: Access of Resource Using Incompatible Type ('Type Confusion')

notes.text: In AzeoTech DAQFactory release 20.7 (Build 2555), an Access of Resource Using Incompatible Type vulnerability can be exploited to cause memory corruption while parsing specially crafted .ctl files. This could allow an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: AzeoTech has released the following update that addresses these issues:
DAQFactory: Release 21.1
AzeoTech also recommends users take the following actions to reduce the risk:
Users are discouraged from using documents from unknown/untrusted sources.
Users are encouraged to store .ctl files in a folder only writeable by admin-level users.
Users are encouraged to operate in "Safe Mode" when loading documents that have been out of their control.
Users are encouraged to apply a document editing password to their documents.

notes.text: In AzeoTech DAQFactory release 20.7 (Build 2555), a Use After Free vulnerability can be exploited to cause memory corruption while parsing specially crafted .ctl files. This could allow an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: AzeoTech has released the following update that addresses these issues:
DAQFactory: Release 21.1
AzeoTech also recommends users take the following actions to reduce the risk:
Users are discouraged from using documents from unknown/untrusted sources.
Users are encouraged to store .ctl files in a folder only writeable by admin-level users.
Users are encouraged to operate in "Safe Mode" when loading documents that have been out of their control.
Users are encouraged to apply a document editing password to their documents.
